meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling a pendulum.
meanings.sent1: The pendular motion of the grandfather clock was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The pendular movement of the swing brought joy to the children.
meanings.sent3: The pendular chandelier swayed gracefully with the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her decision-making process was as pendular as a swinging pendulum.
meanings.sent5: The pendular pattern of the curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.

meanings.definition: Moving back and forth like a pendulum.
meanings.sent1: The pendular motion of the boat made some passengers seasick.
meanings.sent2: The pendular sway of the branches in the wind was calming.
meanings.sent3: The pendular cat toy kept the kitten entertained for hours.
meanings.sent4: His mood was as pendular as the swinging of a pendulum.
meanings.sent5: The pendular rhythm of the music made it hard not to dance along.

meanings.sent1: The pendular movement of the bridge made it thrilling to cross.
meanings.sent2: The pendular motion of the metronome helped the musician keep time.
meanings.sent3: The pendular motion of the hammock put him to sleep in no time.
meanings.sent4: The pendular swing of the wrecking ball demolished the old building.
meanings.sent5: The pendular motion of the clock's hands marked the passage of time.
